title: BoXXoB
author: BoXXoB
content: Hello,I have been away from the forum for a while and a bit out of the loop.Could someone recommend currently active signature designers (or can some signature designers reply here, perhaps)? I did check the other boards for announcements but it's a bit like finding a needle in a haystack.I'd prefer people with a good track record and that I can check their work somewhere.Thank you.

comments.body: You can check this thread: Overview of Bitcointalk Designers(Signature,Avatar,etc)After you click on their profile, make sure you check that they are still active on this forum. I can advice you to use hugeblack or Jayce

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on June 16, 2023, 10:29:47 AMI can advice you to use hugeblack or JayceThank you for recommendation, but this list is very outdated. I stopped making signatures since 2019. I did not make signatures for gambling sites and many altcoins that give false promises to users. Therefore, about 50% of the signature campaigns were out of my interest, and then I decided to stop providing that service.Jayce and Zwei are the two best options in this case.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Everyone knows Jayce has been the best for awhile now. His only competition was RoslinPl back years ago before that account changed hands. I obviously would also recommend Jayce or a contest. Sometimes a little competition brings out the best in everyone.

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Jayce is on top of the market but another good option is icalicalIf you are the owner of a project that needs a design, launching a contest is a good option so you can have the best design for your project, but if it's for your client and the signature is immediate then hiring a designer is the best option, its better to contact the candidates to check their price and additional input.

comments.author: jayce
comments.body: Thank you _act_, hugeblack, Taskford, RickDeckard, yahoo62278, robelneo, for your kind words. It always warms my heart to see anyone recommending my service to others. Sorry for not meriting all of you since I'm running out of it lol, but I really appreciate it. Thanks guys!Quote from: hugeblack on June 18, 2023, 02:53:39 AMJayce is an excellent option, but there is no objection to some competition. We must promote the presence of multiple alternatives in the event that Jayce is no longer online (I wish him safety anyway)I think that the user wants to provide Campaign Management service so relying on 3 designers will be excellent.That's a good point, hugeblack, I agree with that. No one can predict the future, and everything could be changed rapidly in overnight. Honestly, I got perfect timing after the legend of sig designer medUSA left the forum when I was developing my skill. Of course I wasn't that good at that time but no pain no gain. There were so many contests back then which you could proved your skill to everyone on the forum, but yeah the risk is you might get nothing for the time you have spent. Actually creating a contest is a win-win solution for both sides, which as project owner, you can promote your brand even before the signature campaign launches, and for the sig designer, it could be a good place to show your skills. But the problem is, the participation rate is pretty low today comparing to the number of active designers in the list. Hopefully more designers could take a risk and join any contest in the future.I would like to confirm that I have been contacted by the OP few days ago and the work is already in progress. Thank you once again guys.
